docs.snippet: A U.S. judge on Friday imposed a nationwide hold on President Donald Trump's ban on travelers and immigrants from seven predominantly Muslim countries, siding with two states that had challenged the executive order that has launched legal battles ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. judge on Friday imposed a nationwide hold on President Donald Trump's ban on travelers and immigrants from seven predominantly Muslim countries, siding with two states that had challenged the executive order that has launched legal battles across the country.

headline.main: US Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump's Travel Ban Nationwide
headline.print_headline: US Judge Temporarily Blocks Trump's Travel Ban Nationwide

docs.snippet: The American Civil Liberties Union accused the Trump administration in a lawsuit filed on Thursday of violating the religious freedom of some nationals from seven Muslim-majority countries who have been barred from entering the United States....
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Civil Liberties Union accused the Trump administration in a lawsuit filed on Thursday of violating the religious freedom of some nationals from seven Muslim-majority countries who have been barred from entering the United States.

headline.main: Lawsuit Claims Trump Travel Ban Discriminates Against Muslims
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Claims Trump Travel Ban Discriminates Against Muslims

docs.snippet: A watchdog agency at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said it is planning to review how President Donald Trump's immigration executive order to temporarily suspend travel from seven majority-Muslim nations was implemented....
docs.lead_paragraph: A watchdog agency at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said it is planning to review how President Donald Trump's immigration executive order to temporarily suspend travel from seven majority-Muslim nations was implemented.

headline.main: U.S. Watchdog Agency to Review Implementation of Trump Travel Ban

docs.snippet: Federal judges on opposite coasts are due Friday to hear legal arguments defending President Donald Trump's travel ban on citizens from seven predominantly Muslim countries. The ban is sure to reverberate through the courts on a likely path to an ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal judges on opposite coasts are due Friday to hear legal arguments defending President Donald Trump's travel ban on citizens from seven predominantly Muslim countries. The ban is sure to reverberate through the courts on a likely path to an appeals court or the U.S. Supreme Court. Here's a look at how the legal issues may play out:

headline.main: Federal Judges to Hear Arguments Defending Trump Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Federal Judges to Hear Arguments Defending Trump Travel Ban

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers for two brothers denied entry to the U.S. under President Donald Trump's travel ban have reached an agreement with the government, according to court papers filed Thursday.

headline.main: Agreement Reached Between Government, Brothers on Travel Ban

docs.snippet: A judge in Seattle ordered a nationwide halt to the ban while a Boston court refused to extend a stay. Earlier the State Department said 60,000 visas had been revoked....
docs.lead_paragraph: A judge in Seattle ordered a nationwide halt to the ban while a Boston court refused to extend a stay. Earlier the State Department said 60,000 visas had been revoked.

headline.main: Court Temporarily Blocks Trump’s Travel Ban, and Airlines Are Told to Allow Passengers

docs.snippet: A Jordanian teenager who has been held for five days after flying to Houston might have been detained due to heightened scrutiny following President Donald Trump's executive order to curb immigration from seven Muslim-majority countries, according...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Jordanian teenager who has been held for five days after flying to Houston might have been detained due to heightened scrutiny following President Donald Trump's executive order to curb immigration from seven Muslim-majority countries, according to attorneys.

headline.main: Jordanian Teen Caught Up in Extra Scrutiny After Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Jordanian Teen Caught Up in Extra Scrutiny After Travel Ban

docs.snippet: Actress and human rights advocate Angelina Jolie on Thursday said U.S. President Donald Trump's executive order barring travelers from seven Muslim-majority countries hurts vulnerable refugees and could fuel extremism....
docs.lead_paragraph: Actress and human rights advocate Angelina Jolie on Thursday said U.S. President Donald Trump's executive order barring travelers from seven Muslim-majority countries hurts vulnerable refugees and could fuel extremism.
